docs.snippet: Koji Uehara’s success this season as the closer for the Boston Red Sox adds weight to the argument that spending highly on that role is not always the best investment....
docs.lead_paragraph: Koji Uehara’s success this season as the closer for the Boston Red Sox adds weight to the argument that spending highly on that role is not always the best investment.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column says that Koji Uehara’s success this season as the closer for the Boston Red Sox adds weight to the argument that spending highly on that role is not always the best investment; Uehara is in the first year of a two-year, $8.5 million contract that barely registered around baseball last winter, when teams again spent foolishly for saves.

headline.main: The Closer: Not Quite as Important as You Think
headline.print_headline: The Closer: Not Quite as Important as You Think

docs.snippet: As Wladimir Balentien closes in on a single-season home run record of 55, first set by Sadaharu Oh, many fans are now rooting for Oh’s record to fall, a development that once seemed unthinkable....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Wladimir Balentien closes in on a single-season home run record of 55, first set by Sadaharu Oh, many fans are now rooting for Oh’s record to fall, a development that once seemed unthinkable.
docs.abstract: Japanese culture of deference to baseball legend Sadaharu Oh has seemingly ended as many fans are rooting for his record of 55 home runs in single season to fall; Wladimir Balentien, playing for Tokyo Yakult Swallows, may soon surpass Oh's record; younger generation of Japanese is seen as more comfortable than ever with notion of knocking off national heroes.

headline.main: Deference to a Revered Record in Japan Is Going, Going ...
headline.print_headline: Deference to a Revered Record In Japan Is Going, Going ...

docs.snippet: Some three years after helping to push baseball Hall of Famer Jim Bunning out of the U.S. Senate, Republican Leader Mitch McConnell is singing his praises as a political leader who wasn't afraid to stand up for his beliefs in Washington, even when...
docs.lead_paragraph: Some three years after helping to push baseball Hall of Famer Jim Bunning out of the U.S. Senate, Republican Leader Mitch McConnell is singing his praises as a political leader who wasn't afraid to stand up for his beliefs in Washington, even when it meant standing alone.
